author: potuz
content: We should not be doing so, if you see an FCU to before the finalized hash from prysm please do send me the data cause that would be a bug on our side

author: m.kalinin
content: It is invalid to send FCU with a `finalizedBlock` not in a chain defined by the `headBlock`, this is what the check in geth about I suppose

author: m.kalinin
content:
EL may respond `VALID` and do not update the fork choice state if the head block points to an old block in the canonical chain. This is specced in point (2) in the FCU spec https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/paris.md#specification-1

It might be the case you're describing, otherwise, it would be the case when the reorg happens to a chain conflicting with finalized one meaning that something wrong happened on CL side.
